Legal_Issue: Whether the plaintiffs will suffer irreparable harm if an injunction against Novopharm is not granted
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence suggests damages can be quantified, making harm reparable
Burden_of_Proof: Plaintiffs failed to prove irreparable harm
Legal_Rule: Interlocutory injunctions require proof of a serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience favoring the applicant
Grounds_for_Claim: Novopharm's generic version of LOVENOX (enoxaparin sodium) threatened plaintiffs' market dominance
Key_Evidence_Considered: Market share loss, price reduction, reputational damage, quantifiability of damages
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiffs sought to prevent Novopharm from selling its product until trial resolution
Standard_of_Proof: Proof of irreparable harm required but not met
Outcome: Novopharm allowed to proceed with marketing its product
Remedy_Sought: Prevention of sale of generic LOVENOX pending trial
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of proof of irreparable harm
